safety_edibility_notes: Not typically consumed due to cultural taboos and low fat content. Protected in many jurisdictions.
safety_warning_text: Wild wolf attacks on humans are rare but documented. Most attacks involve rabid animals or wolves habituated to humans. Fatal attacks are extremely rare in modern times.
safety_summary: Gray wolves generally avoid humans. Historical attacks were more common but modern wild wolves rarely attack people. Risk increases with habituated wolves or rabid individuals. Never feed wild wolves.
safety_contraindications: Keep dogs leashed in wolf territory
encounter_protocol: Do not run. Make yourself appear larger. Make noise. Maintain eye contact and back away slowly. If attacked, fight back aggressively.
rabies_risk: Wolves can carry rabies. Any wolf approaching humans should be assumed to be rabid until proven otherwise.
legal_protection_status: Endangered Species Act (some populations), varies by state/country
